url.comment: most things below this are just copied from search.json

index.description: A comma-separated list of index names to search; use `_all` or empty string to perform the operation on all indices

type.description: A comma-separated list of document types to search; leave empty to perform the operation on all types

analyzer.description: The analyzer to use for the query string

analyze_wildcard.description: Specify whether wildcard and prefix queries should be analyzed (default: false)

default_operator.description: The default operator for query string query (AND or OR)

df.description: The field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string

explain.description: Specify whether to return detailed information about score computation as part of a hit

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return as part of a hit

fielddata_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return as the field data representation of a field for each hit

ignore_unavailable.description: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

allow_no_indices.description: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

conflicts.note: This is not copied from search
conflicts.description: What to do when the reindex hits version conflicts?

expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

lenient.description: Specify whether format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) should be ignored

lowercase_expanded_terms.description: Specify whether query terms should be lowercased

preference.description: Specify the node or shard the operation should be performed on (default: random)

q.description: Query in the Lucene query string syntax

routing.description: A comma-separated list of specific routing values

scroll.description: Specify how long a consistent view of the index should be maintained for scrolled search

search_timeout.description: Explicit timeout for each search request. Defaults to no timeout.

_source.description: True or false to return the _source field or not, or a list of fields to return

_source_exclude.description: A list of fields to exclude from the returned _source field

_source_include.description: A list of fields to extract and return from the _source field

terminate_after.description: The maximum number of documents to collect for each shard, upon reaching which the query execution will terminate early.

stats.description: Specific 'tag' of the request for logging and statistical purposes

suggest_field.description: Specify which field to use for suggestions

suggest_size.description: How many suggestions to return in response

suggest_text.description: The source text for which the suggestions should be returned

track_scores.description: Whether to calculate and return scores even if they are not used for sorting

version.description: Specify whether to return document version as part of a hit

version_type.description: Should the document increment the version number (internal) on hit or not (reindex)

request_cache.description: Specify if request cache should be used for this request or not, defaults to index level setting

refresh.description: Should the effected indexes be refreshed?

timeout.description: Time each individual bulk request should wait for shards that are unavailable.

consistency.description: Explicit write consistency setting for the operation

scroll_size.description: Size on the scroll request powering the update_by_query

wait_for_completion.description: Should the request should block until the reindex is complete.

requests_per_second.description: The throttle for this request in sub-requests per second. 0 means set no throttle.

body.description: The search definition using the Query DSL
